results.title: Secret beyond the door
results.brief_description: In this example of forties Gothic a woman comes to fear the man to whom she is attached. Here Bennett’s husband is an architect who obsessively collects ‘felicitous rooms’ in which women have been murdered, and she realizes that she must uncover the secret of one room that is always kept locked. Lang brings a precise expressionism to bear on this baroque popularization of Freudian psychoanalysis, creating an atmosphere in which the subconscious seems suspended as in a dream or a nightmare. Cast includes Joan Bennett, Michael Redgrave and Anne Revere. Based on the story by Rufus King.

results.title: Secret agent
results.creator_credit: Sir Michael Balcon, Gaumont and Alfred Hitchcock
results.brief_description: The scenario is an ambiguous one of double identity and meaning. Brodie (Geilgud) is a British novelist turned spy who travels to Switzerland under an assumed name. With him is his fictional wife, (Madeline Carroll), and an eccentric hired assassin known as “The General”, (Peter Lorre). Their mission is to find and kill a German spy, but first they must guess who he is. Based on the novel “Ashenden” by Somerset Maugham, “Secret Agent”, has many features of the quintessential Hitchcock.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Sir Michael Balcon, Gaumont and Alfred Hitchcock

results.title: Seconds count
results.creator_credit: Guy Fergusson and Stewart Hardy Films
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Emergency Resuscitation”

A realistic and dramatic series of incidents likely to be met in service and civilian life, where exhaled air resuscitation may be the quickest or only way of saving life. Emphasises how important it is for the victims, once breathing has restarted, to be taken to hospital for further observations.

results.title: Second serve
results.creator_credit: Linda Yellen, Lorimar Telepictures Productions and Anthony Page
results.brief_description: The moving story of transexual Rene Richards, the male surgeon turned female tennis luminary. It is a story of deep pain, long struggle and great bravery leading to a real victory of the human spirit. Redgrave’s rivetting performance is unforgettable - aging from 22 to 54 and changing from man to woman. She imbues every gesture with dignity and truth as a transexual who did what she knew was right. Co-starring Martin Balsam, William Russ, Alice Krige, Kerrie Keane, Richard Venture, Reni Santoni and Louise Fletcher. Based on the book of the same title by Rene Richards with John Ames.

results.title: Second report on modernisation
results.brief_description: Recent progress in the modernisation and electrification scheme for British Railways. Illustrates some of the new architectural and engineering techniques employed in building railway stations, flyovers, marshalling yards, freight trains and deluxe Pullman carriages. Electronics and automation are prominent features of the new face worn by British Railways’ tracks, stations and offices, and a glimpse of modern training and living facilities for staff is also included.

results.title: Second reality
results.creator_credit: ACMI Digital Storytelling, Stacey Fischer and ACMI
results.brief_description: Always on the move, changing schools, losing new friends, Stacey Fischer escaped from the real world of loneliness to a world where she could create people who couldn’t leave - a place where she would be safe.
results.creator_credit_for_label: ACMI Digital Storytelling, Stacey Fischer and ACMI

results.title: Second life
results.creator_credit: ACMI Digital Storytelling, Ximena Silberman and ACMI
results.brief_description: Ximena migrated to Australia in 2003. To migrate is to be born again. While enjoying her new life in Australia, she looks back at the friendships and life she left behind in Buenos Aires. This Digital Storytelling project was created in partnership with the Jewish Museum of Australia

results.title: Second chorus
results.creator_credit: Boris Morros, Paramount Pictures and H C Potter
results.brief_description: Fred Astaire leads a University orchestra and plays the trumpet while aspiring to great heights. Danny, and his friend and rival, Hank Taylor, vie for Ellen’s affections and a position with the famous Artie Shaw Band. Romance and comedy abound as the beautiful and witty Paulette Godard endeavours to influence her boss, Artie Shaw, into recruiting the talented duo.
